Justification for Mapping: Since it is ambiguous whether the property applies to Expression or Manifestation, use the Manifestation property . ; lna 2022-05-17
Since it is ambiguous whether the property applies to Expression or Manifestation, use the Manifestation property . ; lna 2022-05-17
Assume target audience will not vary between expression and manifestation for Reading Grade Level (ind 1) , so select expression property.
Transformation Notes: Prepend string  Reading grade level:  before contents of $a
Problems with Mapping: Don't see an RDA element or relation that expresses the specificity of the display constant, but add as a prefix needed to make sense of contents of $a
Notes (Uncategorized): Loss of separation of display constant terminology from value of subfield $a - which mIght be controlled from a particular source but is uncontrolled in MARC.  In a specialized setting these values could support special search limiting.

Justification for Mapping: This line with asterisk indicating "any" for Ind 1 value is probably not necessary since all valid conditions are covered by a separate line and the mappings differ.  It might be needed to map data that does not contain a "blank" (#) in the indicator byte.

There doesn't seem to be a way to reference parts of the description to be able to establish an RDA relationship in the MARC mapping, but we could append the materials specified as a parenthetical phrase to the end of the $a note string.
Transformation Notes: Append the string value of subfield 3 , preceded by the label:  Applies to:    .  In  parentheses, coming after the value of $a  and separated by a space.   Example:  Special audience characteristics:  Tactile learners (Applies to: Puzzles)
Notes (Uncategorized): "Loss" of potential separate reference to a part of an expression (or mainfestation) as an aggregated entity.  But since values are not controlled for this field, probably not possible to do anything else in MARC conversion. ; lna 2022-05-17

Justification for Mapping: Provisionally, using unstructured description, use transformation to append contents of this subfield after $a (and after $3, if it is appended) ; lna 2022-05-17
Transformation Notes: Append the string value of subfield b in parentheses and preceded by 'Assigned by: ' after the value of $a (and $3 if present)
Notes (Uncategorized): Example: Special audience characteristics: Tactile learners (Applies to: Puzzles) (Assigned by: LENOCO) "Looks like we would have to reify  the mapping of this field as a metadata work, in order to give a relation that expresses its source (whether a code or just text)."  See discussion on tag 500 mapping.  Do we want to try to revise based on Gordon's example? "Otherwise, we lose the separation between source and the field value." Note subfield values for source are not controlled
